</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager">SectionMemoryManager</a></>}>
This is a simple memory manager which implements the methods called by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> class to allocate memory for section-based loading of objects, usually those generated by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> execution engine. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sectionmemorymanager/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Public Member Functions

### deregisterEHFrames() {#ad0eeea7300381c326cc3bd5e93fbcbf0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::deregisterEHFrames ()"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h/#l00075">75</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h">RTDyldMemoryManager.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp">RTDyldMemoryManager.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### findSymbol() {#a8306f5406b637ac0257f674839a58859}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>JITSymbol llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::findSymbol (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This method returns a RuntimeDyld::SymbolInfo for the specified function or variable.

It is used to resolve symbols during module linking.

By default this falls back on the legacy lookup method: &#39;getSymbolAddress&#39;. The address returned by getSymbolAddress is treated as a strong, exported symbol, consistent with historical treatment by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a>.

Clients writing custom RTDyldMemoryManagers are encouraged to override this method and return a SymbolInfo with the flags set correctly. This is necessary for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> to correctly handle weak and non-exported symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h">RTDyldMemoryManager.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### findSymbolInLogicalDylib() {#a2f54c196c4be75015b4edb4f4ac1a92d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>JITSymbol llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::findSymbolInLogicalDylib (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Default to treating all modules as separate.

By default this falls back on the legacy lookup method: &#39;getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib&#39;. The address returned by getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib is treated as a strong, exported symbol, consistent with historical treatment by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a>.

Clients writing custom RTDyldMemoryManagers are encouraged to override this method and return a SymbolInfo with the flags set correctly. This is necessary for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> to correctly handle weak and non-exported symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h/#l00123">123</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h">RTDyldMemoryManager.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPointerToNamedFunction() {#a4e5d745e695dc62ebaec15f537af9fed}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void &#42; llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::getPointerToNamedFunction (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name, bool AbortOnFailure=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method returns the address of the specified function.

As such it is only useful for resolving library symbols, not code generated symbols.

If <code>AbortOnFailure</code> is false and no function with the given name is found, this function returns a null pointer. Otherwise, it prints a message to stderr and aborts.

This function is deprecated for memory managers to be used with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a>. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> getSymbolAddress instead.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h">RTDyldMemoryManager.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp/#l00280">280</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp">RTDyldMemoryManager.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getSymbolAddress() {#a5275cacbaa1ca16fc934fb65171e8fe2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual uint64&#95;t llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::getSymbolAddress (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Legacy symbol lookup - DEPRECATED!

Please override findSymbol instead.

This method returns the address of the specified function or variable. It is used to resolve symbols during module linking.

</MemberDefinition>

### getSymbolAddressInLogicalDylib() {#abb87ff0ecf55f84ec9306f54bfb25241}

</MemberDefinition>

### registerEHFrames() {#a34aa575afca6c18d934c5fd87da71043}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::RTDyldMemoryManager::registerEHFrames (uint8&#95;t &#42; Addr, uint64&#95;t LoadAddr, size&#95;t Size)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> the EH frames with the runtime so that c++ exceptions work.

<code>Addr</code> parameter provides the local address of the EH frame section data, while <code>LoadAddr</code> provides the address of the data in the target address space. If the section has not been remapped (which will usually be the case for local execution) these two values will be the same.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h/#l00074">74</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/rtdyldmemorymanager-h">RTDyldMemoryManager.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp/#l00127">127</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/runtimedyld/rtdyldmemorymanager-cpp">RTDyldMemoryManager.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
